intro: Coelogyne atjehensis, commonly known as the Atjeh orchid, is a rare and striking orchid native to the highlands of Sumatra. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces showy, lance-shaped petals and a distinctive, narrow lip that enhances its ornamental appeal. It thrives in cool, shaded environments with high humidity and well-drained soil. Coelogyne atjehensis is valued for its beauty and is often cultivated by orchid enthusiasts.
